image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch

props.synopsis: Conspiracy theories about the murder of Peter Falconio dogged his family and girlfriend Joanne Lees for as long as Bradley Murdoch denied his guilt. So where does the truth lie?

title.children: Was Bradley Murdoch guilty? Court transcripts and experts reveal the truth

image.altText: A wide shot of a strip of shops with cars parked in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Joseph Wunungmurra, 39, has been sentenced for his role in a fatal assault on a man outside the Rapid Creek shopping centre in 2023.

title.children: Man jailed for six years for fatal assault outside Darwin shopping centre

image.altText: The bonnent of an NT police car that reads "police" and has the NT police force emblem. Green leaves blurred in right corner.

props.synopsis: Police have charged the 34-year-old man with sexual intercourse with a child under 10, over an incident at a Ludmilla home last month.

title.children: Man charged with rape of child under 10 in Darwin's northern suburbs

image.altText: An Aboriginal child in a black adidas shirt holding an Aboriginal toddler in a white and balck shirt, on a basketball court

props.synopsis: The Kumanjayi Walker Inquest backs Aboriginal-led solutions and restoring Warlpiri self-determination, which his family says will "prevent deaths in custody".

title.children: Police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker could lead to NT communities taking back full control

image.altText: A graphic of three women in black and white with a purple background.

props.synopsis: Facing the highest rates of domestic and family violence in Australia, experts in the Northern Territory's DV sector have identified five ways the NT can become a safer place for women and children.

title.children: Facing Australia's highest DV rates, these experts have five key solutions

image.altText: Albo and panda

props.synopsis: The prime minister says his high-profile visits to the Great Wall and a giant panda breeding and research centre were about showing "respect" to his host country.

title.children: Albanese rejects Coalition criticism his six-day China visit wasn't 'strictly necessary'

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media in the White House Press Room.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump undergoes a medical exam after noticing his legs swelling.

title.children: Donald Trump diagnosed with vein condition that causes leg swelling

image.altText: Two women with shoulder-length hair smile at the camera, with one wearing a black-and-white backpack

props.synopsis: The move would allow 16-year-olds to vote at the next UK national election and would be the biggest change to the country's electorate in more than half a century.

title.children: UK to allow 16-year-olds to vote in biggest electoral change since 1969

image.altText: Parts of an Air India plane that crashedare seen on top of a building near trees with snapped branches.

props.synopsis: A preliminary report released on Saturday identified the fuel control switches in the cockpit as the key reason why Air India flight 171 crashed into a residential neighbourhood only seconds after takeoff.

title.children: Investigators urge public not to speculate on causes of Air India crash

image.altText: Dmitry Medvedev sitting at a conference table with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Dmitry Medvedev says Russia needs to be ready to respond, potentially with pre-emptive strikes, if the West escalated its involvement in the Ukraine war.

title.children: Russia must be willing to strike West, country's former president says

image.altText: Microscope image showing tiny red and green specks of genetically modified bacteria against larger blue mammalian cells.

props.synopsis: Researchers tested a genetically engineered gut bacterium to try to limit kidney stones. But once inside some human volunteers, the modified microbe did not follow the plan.

title.children: Study leaves two people with genetically modified gut bacteria

image.altText: CCTV shows an inmate on the ground wrapped in a blanket in  a cell at Brisbane watch house

props.synopsis: A recent review by police into the state's 63 watch houses found children were spending an average of 161 hours in the facilities.

title.children: Queensland won't limit how long children can be held in watch houses

image.altText: Close up of man wearing glasses

props.synopsis: Joshua Maxwell was told his open-heart surgery had to be done within 90 days at Westmead Hospital. He waited 200 days, and says the lack of a direct apology from the health minister is "disappointing".

title.children: Patient who waited 200 days for surgery calls out 'radio silence' from minister

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: With the fourth election in seven years almost upon Tasmania, one thing is certain — more is needed from politicians to ensure good government is the norm, not the exception.

title.children: Tasmanians weren't ready for this election — neither were their politicians

image.altText: A Parliament House in the early morning sun.

props.synopsis: All published polls indicate a hung parliament is the most likely result of Saturday's Tasmanian state election — who are the potential crossbenchers and what do they want?

title.children: Crossbench MPs expected to hold power after Tasmanian election

image.altText: Tom Lynagh poses for a photo wearing Wallabies colours.

props.synopsis: Tom Lynagh's Wallabies teammates hold the key to making his job easier in the first Test against the British and Irish Lions in Brisbane on Saturday night.

title.children: Wallabies taking a gamble with Lynagh but risks have paid off before

image.altText: A group of GWS players surround a smiling forward after he has kicked a goal.

props.synopsis: The Bombers finish strongly to stop GWS clinching a big percentage boost, but the Giants enter the top four as Jake Stringer has a big night against his old club.

title.children: GWS crack top four as Jake Stringer has big night against old club Bombers

image.altText: Reuben Cotter of the Cowboys looking at the ground, exhausted

props.synopsis: North Queensland Cowboys co-captain Reuben Cotter has urged the club's fans to "stick with us" after their finals aspirations took a hammer blow on Thursday night.

title.children: Cowboys co-captain urges fans to 'stick with us' after Dolphins carve up

image.altText: Tadej Pogacar points his finger in the air

props.synopsis: Tadej Pogačar underlines his greatness with a crushing victory in the Tour de France's 12th stage up the fearsome Hautacam climb.

title.children: Pogačar crushes rivals with stunning climb

image.altText: Queen Street Mall, Brisbane 2025-01-09 10:01:00

props.synopsis: ABS data shows Australia's unemployment rate rose by 0.2 percentage points in June, after the Reserve Bank surprised markets last week by keeping interest rates on hold.

title.children: 'Aged like milk': RBA's rates decision panned as unemployment jumps to 4.3pc

image.altText: A police van in car on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: Police found the man non-responsive after being called to the Dolphin Heads home for a welfare check.

title.children: Man found dead in backyard on Mackay's Northern Beaches

image.altText: Beyonce tips a black cowboy hat, wears shiny black long white blonde hair, nails long, background blurred.

props.synopsis: From a theft of unreleased Beyonce music to Albanese's Asian tour, it's been a big week in news. Test your knowledge.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A diplomatic visit, stolen music and a stage alight

image.altText: A downcast President Trump walks from a jungle green helicopter across the White House lawn

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's derision of some supporters as "weaklings" is the latest spray in an ongoing attempt to shift the public conversation past calls for the full release of files linked to the Jeffrey Epstein case. Experts say his approach could fall flat with some of his most fervent supporters.

title.children: How experts say Trump set his own trap on the Epstein files

image.altText: Illustration shows a power board with Mlaaysia's city skyline emerging out of it in blues and purples.

props.synopsis: Malaysia is hoping to become a regional leader in the digital economy, but environmental, resource and geopolitical challenges loom.

title.children: How this small nation has caught the attention of the tech giants

image.altText: Two women with arms on their hips in a large hall, some dancers hang around a stage

props.synopsis: Three of Ukraine's most celebrated dancers have travelled from war-torn Kyiv to Australia to conduct a week-long traditional dance masterclass.

title.children: Honoured Ukrainian dancers 'pass legacy on' as war continues

image.altText: A black and white photo of Gough Whitlam and Mark Latham in university robes

props.synopsis: He once had a chance at the top job in the nation — now Mark Latham is defending himself against allegations of domestic abuse and being involved in a sex tape in his NSW parliamentary office.

title.children: New chapter in story of a man who was once a protégé of Gough Whitlam

image.altText: A close up of ice on a fence at dawn

props.synopsis: It will be a wet start to the weekend in much of Queensland, but sunny days are not far away — except in the north where showers are expected.

title.children: Mixed bag for Qld weather with showers moving north, says bureau

image.altText: A swift parrot perching on a branch

props.synopsis: A gathering of close to the total estimated population of swift parrots excites ecologists, but they warn it is no party for the critically endangered species.

title.children: Massive flock of critically endangered swift parrots seen in one spot

image.altText: The mangled remains of a vehicle near an SUV and a ute, also seriously damaged, on a road. Emergency personnel are nearby.

props.synopsis: Victorian man Peter Agius sent and received more than 80 Snapchat messages in the lead-up to the 2023 crash that killed Adam Sutton, who had just picked his son up from his first day of school.

title.children: Jail for Snapchatting driver who killed young dad, gave 6yo brain damage

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Scott Alexander McDougall became the first convicted murderer in the ACT more than a decade when he was found guilty of murdering two people.

title.children: Double murderer who killed victims with meat cleaver may be released

image.altText: A young man with curly blonde hair wears an apron and holds his arms up to display his biceps.

props.synopsis: Several witnesses have told the inquest into Brady Hubbard's death three West Ulverstone Football Club members lied to others at the club and "covered up" how he was injured. Those three men have now given evidence.

title.children: Footballer may have been thrown from ute and fatally injured, court hears

image.altText: Smoke and flames are seen billowing from a house on fire

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with two counts of attempted murder after a fire in Melbourne's south-east left her and her two children in a critical condition.

title.children: Mother due in court on attempted murder charges of girls in house fire

image.altText: A black and white screenshot of a scene with a sled and snow

props.synopsis: The sled is one of only three known to survive and was miraculously saved from disposal by The Gremlins director Joe Dante in 1984.

title.children: Citizen Kane's iconic Rosebud sled sells at auction for more than $22 million
